issue.description: Part of the sequence of Rims1 (GeneID:116837) falls in the assembly gap between CAAA01187890.1 and CAAA01224532.1; there also appear to be functional differences between the proteins encoded by the Rims1 RefSeq (NM_183018.2) and the genomic sequence to which it aligns.

issue.resolution_text: NT_162750 (AC132444.3 ) has the best representation for RefSeq NM_033616.3 (Gene ID: 114564, Csprs). It has been placed as a component of the Mouse Chromosome 1 Unlocalized TPF, which is supported by mapping information.

issue.description: NM_134252.3 has 8 mismatches compared to AC087780.19 and overlapping BAC AC102505.8. The mismatches are all in the region NC_000067. NM_134252.3 also aligns with a non-consensus splice site.
issue.resolution_text: PCR performed and errors found in the reference component AC087780. The PCR has been submitted to EMBL/GenBank accession FQ976922.1, this has been added to the TPF to correct the reference.

issue.description: AC110895.14 has two insertions close together in the Col6a3 gene.
issue.resolution_text: PCR performed and errors found in the reference component AC110895. The PCR has been submitted to EMBL/GenBank accession FQ976558.1, this has been added to the TPF to correct the reference.

issue.summary: SNP analysis of the Mouse Genomes Project suggests a possible single nucleotide error in reference clone AC115011.27
issue.status_text: The reference has been verified, but the existence of contradictory C57BL/6J sequences may be evidence for unrecognized intra-strain variation. This issue will be re-visited when an SOP for investigation of mouse variation is developed.
issue.description: SNP analysis of the Mouse Genomes Project suggests a possible single nucleotide error in reference clone AC115011.27
issue.resolution_text: na

issue.description: AK087744.1 aligns to several loci on NT_039173.7 and also to several unplaced contigs. The best alignment to NT_039173.7 isn't great (the location is currently annotated at NCBI as A530040E14Rik), and the ESTs and mRNAs that align here have some consistent mismatches suggesting that they are actually derived from another gene. AK087744.1 is a C57BL/6J sequence.
issue.resolution_text: na

issue.description: NG_029380.1, based on AC116997.3:124884 - 125564(-), appears to be an Atp6 pseudogene. It's 97% identical to the Atp6 sequence from NC_010339.1. A nuclear pseudogene of a mitochondrial gene is not unheard of, but still kind of unusual, so just want to check and make sure that there's no chance that this is some mitochondrial contamintation in AC116997.
issue.resolution_text: na

issue.description: NM_001243008.1 contains 2 indels (between nt 9343^9344 and 9350^9351) in the CDS compared to the reference genome. The indels are supported by all available transcripts (>15), and correction of the indels to match the reference genome results in a truncated protein.
issue.resolution_text: PCR performed and errors found in the reference component AC110895. The PCR has been submitted to EMBL/GenBank accession FQ976558.1, this has been added to the TPF to correct the reference.

issue.status_text: 27-SEP-11: RP24-281F5 is ready to enter the sequencing pipeline 2012_06_29: WI1-2819D19 has been cancelled Accession for WI1-2819D19: FQ976857
issue.description: The introduction of the component AC122792 between AC170917 and AC174596 has made it necessary to raise another ticket to deal with the extra gap. MG-3519 will now deal with the gap between AC170917 and AC122792. This ticket will deal with the gap between AC122792 and AC174596.
issue.resolution_text: na

issue.summary: Possible vector contamination in alt loci clone AC006944.13 (RP22-225P5)
issue.description: AC006944.13 (RP22-225P5) is a component of MGSCv37 alt loci scaffold NT_039194.4. It has vector contamination at it's 3' end that was excluded from MGSCv37. The GRC must exclude this contamination from future assemblies.
issue.resolution_text: The vector contamination in AC006944.13 (RP22-225P5) has been trimmed, and the sequence has been re-submitted with acc.ver AC006944.14.

issue.summary: Contamination in component AC164522.2 to be addressed
issue.description: Contamination in component AC164522.2 (19171..19947) to be addressed
issue.resolution_text: PCR_C57BL6J_AC164522_1 has been created to successfully exclude the contamination.

issue.resolution_text: AL645584.27 updated to AL645584.28, adding 10270bp of repetitive sequence

issue.summary: Reject blunt join certifcate for AC132289.3/AC093477.6
issue.description: Blunt join certifcate for AC132289.3/AC093477.6 should be rejected, as the two sequences do not abut one another.
issue.resolution_text: Blunt join certifcate rejected for AC132289.3/AC093477.6 as the two sequences do not abut one another. There is a 506 bp gap between them.

issue.summary: Issue reported from Web Site: possible MT sequence on chr.1?
issue.description: A region on ChrI has a 100% sequence identity to ChrM. Is there a problem with the mouse assembly in this regions.
issue.resolution_text: Nuclear DNA sequences of mitochondrial origin, are present in most eukaryotic genomes. Fragments of mtDNA can give rise to nuclear mitochondrial sequences (NumtS) and are believed to derive from damaged mitochondria

issue.summary: Issue reported from Web Site: possible MT sequence on various chromosomes?
issue.description: Reads from RIP-Seq analysis on Mouse Embryonic Fibroblast cells aligned to the mouse genome (mm9) showed three highly upregulated regions in the data matched to a reference chromosome and ChrM. Is there a problem with the mouse assembly in these regions.
issue.resolution_text: Nuclear DNA sequences of mitochondrial origin, are present in most eukaryotic genomes. Fragments of mtDNA can give rise to nuclear mitochondrial sequences (NumtS) and are believed to derive from damaged mitochondria

issue.summary: PCR to deal with questionable base in FO082283.1 (PCR_C57BL6J_AC164522_1)
issue.description: The PCR sequence for FO082283.1 (PCR_C57BL6J_AC164522_1). Appears to have an unexpected insertion ("A") in the PCR product at AC164522.2 (20,199/20,200). Redo PCR to check this base.
issue.resolution_text: The questionable base was checked and has been removed from the submission.

issue.summary: Overlapping alignment between AC005992.15 and AC008100.71 (129X1/SvJ) on NC_00067.6 (C57BL/6J)
issue.description: Two alt loci from the 129X1/SvJ alt loci unit (129X1/SVJ_MMCHR1_CTG2 (GL456005.1/NT_039195.1) & 129X1/SVJ_MMCHR1_CTG1 (JH584315.1/NT_187017.1) overlap in their alignments on NC_000067.6 (C57BL/6J).
